prompt: Photorealistic close-up shot of various antique Duraglas bottles arranged on a weathered wooden table. Bottles include different colors (clear, amber, green), shapes (soda, milk, medicine), and embossed markings. Focus on the texture of the glass, imperfections, and aged labels (if present). Soft, diffused natural light from a window on the left, creating subtle highlights and shadows. Shallow depth of field, blurring the background to emphasize the bottles. --ar 16:9
name: antique-duraglas-bottles-value-image-1.png

prompt: A brightly lit studio shot featuring a single, pristine Duraglas soda bottle from the 1950s. The bottle is standing upright against a clean, white background. The bottle is filled with a vintage-looking clear soda with visible bubbles. The focus is razor-sharp, highlighting the 'Duraglas' embossed logo. The lighting is even and professional, with no harsh shadows. The overall style is clean and modern, emphasizing the bottle's design. --ar 16:9
name: antique-duraglas-bottles-value-image-2.png

prompt: A vintage general store scene depicting shelves stocked with various Duraglas bottles. The bottles are filled with different products, such as spices, candies, and liquids, all with aged labels. The store interior is dimly lit, with light streaming in from a window. Focus on the details of the store, including the wooden shelves, old signage, and other vintage items. The overall atmosphere is nostalgic and authentic, capturing the era when these bottles were commonly used. --ar 16:9
name: antique-duraglas-bottles-value-image-3.png

prompt: A macro shot of the base of an antique Duraglas bottle, focusing on the Owens-Illinois glass company's trademark symbol (the 'I' inside a circle) and date code. The glass surface is slightly scratched and worn, showing its age. The lighting is dramatic and focused, highlighting the details of the markings. The background is blurred and out of focus, drawing attention to the trademark. The image is highly detailed and technical, suitable for identifying and dating the bottles. --ar 16:9
name: antique-duraglas-bottles-value-image-4.png

prompt: A split-screen image: On the left, a black and white archival photograph of a Duraglas bottle manufacturing line in the 1940s. On the right, a modern-day photograph of a collector carefully examining an antique Duraglas bottle with a magnifying glass. The lighting on the left side mimics the grainy, high-contrast style of vintage photography. The right side is well-lit and sharp, showcasing the bottle's details. This juxtaposition highlights the history and collectibility of Duraglas bottles. --ar 16:9
name: antique-duraglas-bottles-value-image-5.png
